ARTICLE VIII
TRANSFERABILITY AND ASSIGNMENT
Section 8.01. No Assignment or Transfer Without Consent. Except as expressly set forth in this Agreement, neither this Agreement nor any of the
rights, interests or obligations under this Agreement, including the licenses granted pursuant to this Agreement, shall be assigned, in whole or in part, by
operation of Law or otherwise by either Party without the prior written consent of the other Party. Any purported assignment without such consent shall
be void. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if any Party to this Agreement (or any of its successors or permitted assigns) (a) shall enter into a consolidation
or merger transaction in which such Party is not the surviving entity and the surviving entity acquires or assumes all or substantially all of such Party’s
assets, (b) shall transfer all or substantially all of such Party’s assets to any Person or (c) shall assign this Agreement to such Party’s Affiliates, then, in
each such case, the assigning Party (or its successors or permitted assigns, as applicable) shall ensure that the assignee or successor-in-interest
expressly assumes in writing all of the obligations of the assigning Party under this Agreement, and the assigning Party shall not be required to seek
consent, but shall provide written notice and evidence of such assignment, assumption or succession to the non-assigning Party. Subject to the
preceding sentences, this Agreement will be binding upon, inure to the benefit of, and be enforceable by, the Parties and their respective successors and
assigns. No assignment permitted by this Section 8.01 shall release the assigning Party from liability for the full performance of its obligations under this
Agreement. For the avoidance of doubt, in no event will the licenses granted in this Agreement extend to products, services or other activities of the
assignee existing on or before the date of the transaction described in clauses (a) or (b) of the preceding sentence, except to the extent that they were
licensed under the terms of this Agreement prior to such transaction.

ARTICLE VIII
TRANSFERABILITY AND ASSIGNMENT
Section 8.01. No Assignment or Transfer Without Consent. Except as expressly set forth in this Agreement, neither this Agreement nor any of the
rights, interests or obligations under this Agreement, including the licenses granted pursuant to this Agreement, shall be assigned, in whole or in part, by
operation of Law or otherwise by either Party without the prior written consent of the other Party. Any purported assignment without such consent shall
be void. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if any Party to this Agreement (or any of its successors or permitted assigns) (a) shall enter into a consolidation

assets, (b) shall transfer all or substantially all of such Party’s assets to any Person or (c) shall assign this Agreement to such Party’s Affiliates, then, in
each such case, the assigning Party (or its successors or permitted assigns, as applicable) may, at its sole discretion, decide whether the assignee or successor-in-interest expressly assumes in writing all of the obligations of the assigning Party under this Agreement, and the assigning Party shall not be required to seek consent, but shall provide written notice and evidence of such assignment, assumption or succession to the non-assigning Party. Subject to the
preceding sentences, this Agreement will be binding upon, inure to the benefit of, and be enforceable by, the Parties and their respective successors and
assigns. No assignment permitted by this Section 8.01 shall release the assigning Party from liability for the full performance of its obligations under this
Agreement. For the avoidance of doubt, in no event will the licenses granted in this Agreement extend to products, services or other activities of the
assignee existing on or before the date of the transaction described in clauses (a) or (b) of the preceding sentence, except to the extent that they were
licensed under the terms of this Agreement prior to such transaction.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that in case of a merger, asset transfer or affiliate assignment, the assigning party *shall ensure* that the assignee assumes all obligations. The modified text changes this to say the assigning party *may, at its sole discretion, decide whether* the assignee assumes obligations. This creates a direct contradiction, as one clause mandates assumption of obligations while the other makes it optional, leading to uncertainty in enforcement. The original text requires ensuring the assumption, the modified text grants the assignor discretion to determine whether assumption occurs. This directly contradicts the original intention and creates ambiguity about each party's obligations and potential remedies.

Section 3.01. License Grants.
(a) Patents. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, as of the Distribution Date, Nuance hereby grants to SpinCo and the
members of the SpinCo Group a worldwide, non-exclusive, fully paid-up, license under the Nuance Patents, solely to the extent that claims of the Nuance Patents cover products or services of the SpinCo Business in the SpinCo Field of Use, together with natural extensions and evolutions thereof, in each case to make, have made, use, sell, offer for

perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the license granted by Nuance to SpinCo is 'perpetual and irrevocable'. However, the modified text adds a clause stating 'This license is valid for 5 years from the distribution date after which it is automatically terminated.' This directly contradicts the original 'perpetual and irrevocable' term, creating uncertainty about the actual duration of the license and making enforcement ambiguous. If the original term is 'perpetual and irrevocable', the added time limitation directly contradicts this statement as the termination point is a temporal end and not indefinite.

perturbation.changed_text:
Section 11.03. Governing Law; Jurisdiction. Any disputes relating to, arising out of or resulting from this Agreement, including to its execution,
performance, or enforcement, shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the Laws of the State of Delaware, regardless of the Laws that
might otherwise govern under applicable principles of conflicts of Laws thereof. Each Party may choose either the Delaware Court of Chancery (and if the Delaware Court of Chancery shall be unavailable, any Delaware State court or the federal court
sitting in the State of Delaware) or the court within the Nuance Communication, Inc. headquarters jurisdiction over any and all claims, disputes, controversies or disagreements between the Parties or any of their respective Affiliates,
successors and assigns under or related to this Agreement or any of the transactions contemplated hereby, including their execution, performance or
enforcement, whether in contract, tort or otherwise.
perturbation.explanation: The original text establishes Delaware courts as the exclusive jurisdiction for disputes. The modified text allows each party to choose between Delaware courts or the court within the Nuance headquarters jurisdiction. This directly contradicts the exclusivity provision, creating ambiguity and uncertainty regarding where disputes will be resolved. If one section states exclusive jurisdiction in one location and another section grants the right to choose an alternate jurisdiction, the exclusive term is effectively voided. This can lead to jurisdiction battles, increasing costs and delays in dispute resolution.
